data.text: @WyattVW Exactly Wyatt whats the big deal with this story!?🤔
@WyattVW But as a role model and a UNICEF Ambassador he should admit he got away with it on a technicality and do the punishment appropriate for the crime he has admitted to.
@WyattVW He didn’t think of that
@WyattVW But I guess we wouldn’t be discussing this if he didn’t speed in the first place!

@chris_jay_1 The law is the law! It has to have limits and guidelines or what's the point? If the prosecuting party can't get their admin in order in a timely manner then that's on them.....not the alleged offender.
@WyattVW Yes but he was speeding and he should have to account for that. I don’t understand how a late arriving notice can mean there is no case to answer. The law is an ass in this situation

@WyattVW But it doesn’t make it right.
The law DOES need to be changed.
Why did he involved mr loophole if he knew he was speeding?
Shirking smirking eejit.

@ManUtdMrs Which was his real mistake...admitting it. 
He didn't need to as it was irrelevant to the fact the notice of intended prosecution had timed out so a court case wouldn't be happening...

@WyattVW Just man up and pay the fine like ordinary people.
He admitted speeding.
@WyattVW Had to sit a driver awareness class for four hours last night to avoid points and a fine, lesson be more aware !!
@Jfk4Blues If he'd known the system and statute of limitations (to be fair many don't) he could have done it himself by post. I'd recommend sending it recorded delivery though....just in case :)
@WyattVW No he just used a damn good lawyer !!

@WyattVW He got away with it, lucky him, but he was still breaking the law (cue for a song, there) and driving like a complete arsehole. Ok, no drummers lost their arms or died but it's still a bloody irresponsible thing to do.

@WyattVW @hoops1916 Just as well I’ve got kyuss on in the back ground , yeah I hear what you’re saying but you don’t need to be punished for you to of broken the law , as soon as you’ve done whatever it is illegal you have broken the law . Judicial process comes next so we OJ didn’t break the law?
@breengekdy @hoops1916 For a punishment / endorsement to be apllied to a charge you would need to be convicted....in a court of law....not a court of other people's minds and moral standing.

@chris_jay_1 personal opinion aside it is the difference between ethics and law. Because the charge was brought about the incorrect way there is no case to answer. He didn't have to admit to speeding. No idea why he did that. He wasn't actually prosecuted for speeding...

@WyattVW @hoops1916 You don’t have to be convicted to have broken the law ! That’s the point  ( I think ) 😂 you steal something have you broken the law ? What does the law say, its illegal to steal something ( not just immoral) there’s a big diff. To breaking the law and being convicted

@hoops1916 @breengekdy ha ha. we are almost debating two seperate issues one being ethics and the other being law. Like the difference between tax avoidance and evasion. One is ethical the other is lawful.  Back to the music....
@WyattVW I’d do it
@hoops1916 I don't think he'd have to worry about kids walking along the elevated section of the A40 dual carriageway in West London 🙂
@WyattVW But he WAS speeding and he admitted it. Despicable hypocrite he is.
@hoops1916 @breengekdy I'd give up because you haven't proved anything lawful, and can't because there is no case to answer. End of.
@WyattVW Let's see how many column inches this story gets.... not as if there is any other important matters to talk about. https://t.co/gU4hxsgzeV
@breengekdy @hoops1916 but you have to be tried or/and convicted to have "officially" broken the law, for it to become lawful and a lawful conviction. I'm not sure what point you are trying to make?
@WyattVW @hoops1916 Technically you break the law as soon as you’ve committed an act which is unlawful ? You’ve not been convicted if you get off with it but still broken the law ?
@WyattVW @Deggsietwit Loophole, boundary whatever we’d still have done the same in that position
@RyanJShaw94 @Deggsietwit You're right, except it's not a loophole. It's a boundary of law ha. It's their fault for being rubbish with their admin :)
@Deggsietwit @WyattVW Funny because I’d bet my last dollar that most if not all would use the same loophole to get out of it no matter your status

@breengekdy @hoops1916 In theory. You'd have to be arrested and charged and then convicted for it, for you to have "broken the law"
People seem to be confusing moral standpoints/ ethics etc with facts of law!
@WyattVW @hoops1916 Interesting , so I can kill someone but if nobody notices then I’ve not broke the law ..I can handle that 😳
@kieronjfranks @WyattVW Because he can’t spell 14 Days!

@D1ggaGa @WyattVW The woman who sent the letter out said..the first class machine was broken..had to use second class..it all seems fishy to me..15 days for a second class letter? I bet the Bentley dealership has 2 letter stamps..one for the public,one for celebrities..😂
@GhostTatts @WyattVW You just speed in a Bentley rental car..they record every piece of mail and can doctor any letter.. 😂
@WyattVW Your correct..his other ticket for speeding in the same car a few weeks before arrived on time...

@WyattVW Absolutely!

(Although if I can be one, it's not that much of an achievement! 😂)
@GhostTatts Am I talking like I can be one?? :)

@hoops1916 I'm not talking shit at all. He didn't break the law because their was no case to defend or answer. So no he didn't break the law. Say what you like to or about me it doesn't change the FACTS of the situation. The moral stand point or opinion is a moot point versus law!

@WyattVW Totally agree.

I was being devil's advocate a little. I'm a defence lawyer
@WyattVW I know where to come next time then ! That said, I got out of a parking ticket a couple of months ago - lovely feeling ! 😊🤟🏻
@Deggsietwit I would have :)

@GhostTatts You have to provide dilligence that it hadn't been recived which is the grey area. Legally the issuer just has to prove it WAS sent. To avoid this issue all the releavant issue party has to do is not cost cut and simply send the notices recorded delivery within 14 days! Sorted!

@WyattVW And it does seem that people have their knives out for the Beckhams at the moment. I can appreciate both sides of this but feel that the average layman wouldn't have 'got away' with this due to lack of knowledge/legal support (ie, Mr Loophole)
@WyattVW Maybe a short ban ? I don't know, and let's face it, we've all put the foot down at some point ! 🚗💨

@WyattVW My point is that he was CLEARLY speeding, by almost 50%, so he should take it on the chin. I understand why one wouldn't as driving is such a necessity for many of us, so the invalid notice is very poor form on the issuing authority. Becks probably didn't even notice the date 🤪
@WyattVW So the answer is always say the notice arrived out of time. Who is going to know
@Deggsietwit Ps you wouldn't get banned for 59 in a 40....unless you went up to 12 points or over :)

@Deggsietwit No it's not as simple as that all. Anyone, even you and I, can point out the Notice Of Intended Prosecution is out of date and therefore invalid. NO-ONE can be brought to court with an invaid notice once pointed out. If you could it undermines the entire justice system!

@WyattVW He was doing 59 in a 40 zone. He's guilty as sin but got off on a technicality. Pathetic, for a so called role model who could take it on the chin, pay the fine, hire a chauffeur for the ban period etc. He got off because he could afford to buy the legal support. Simple as that
@WyattVW 👍

@hoops1916 He didn't though. To have broken the law you would need to be convicted & be proved guilty. If the prosecuting constabulary can't get their notices out in time that's on them not the accused.
You can't be convicted of a crime from an invalid notice.That just undermines the system
@WyattVW So why did he hire a lawyer?
